title: Bad "try_into" usage causes message "the trait bound `u8: From<char>` is not satisfied"

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=705695b1b99a0894bc73e755bfc8ad63

```rust
fn main() {
    let _: u8 = 'a'.try_into().unwrap();
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0277]: the trait bound `u8: From<char>` is not satisfied
 --> src/main.rs:2:21
  |
2 |     let _: u8 = 'a'.try_into().unwrap();
  |                     ^^^^^^^^ the trait `From<char>` is not implemented for `u8`
  |
  = help: the following implementations were found:
            <u8 as From<NonZeroU8>>
            <u8 as From<bool>>
  = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `Into<u8>` for `char`
  = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `TryFrom<char>` for `u8`
  = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `TryInto<u8>` for `char`

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0277`.
error: could not compile `playground` due to previous error
```

The output should mention TryInto or TryFrom instead of From
